Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

All castes of the Kir’Ko rejoice, as today we land on Xa'Kir'Ko. From the humble Hidden up to the majestic Harbinger every individual of the swarm is sharpening their senses to embrace the welcoming moments on our ancient home world. Many colonies have answered my call, and our fleet has been constantly growing with new arrivals since we departed Arcadia Caeleste.

This return will mark the beginning of a new era for the Kir’Ko. As we reunite and reclaim our heritage, we cast off the last shackles from the Zok’Shiar and take the fate of our race into our own claws. In ancient times the Kir’Ko swarm channeled its hive through the Ez’Qi’Yu, the Queen of Queens. There are rumors of another Swarm Herald trying to recreate the Queen - and the secret of our lost hive along with her.

Xa’Kir’Ko lies ahead, a heavenly body encircled by mists of cosmite and stardust. What wonders and ancient mysteries will be awaiting us on the surface? Let us descend and have every step we take be a journey to the secrets of our past![br/][br/]Xa’Kir’Ko, your children are returning home.

At last! Swarm Seer Cekto Xa’To was right! The genetic structure of the Ez’Qi’Yu has been revealed, her DNA imprinted in the ancestral stem of a nurtured Harbinger. And now the Hive Queen returns to her people! She shapes the swarm, the swarm shapes her… Our united will…[br/][br/]We are Kir’Ko!

Once more, our people have defended their independence and freedom. Never again shall any Kir’Ko return to be a slave – not to a human, not to their empire, not even to our own Queen of Queens. Maybe one day Cekto Xa’To’s vision of a new Hive will become reality. Until then we must rely on our newfound strength and stop recalling a past that can never return.
Recover data from the Codon-17 Lab
Enter the Xenolab and recover the data pertaining to the Queens.
Recover data from the Locus X3 Lab
Enter the Xenolab and recover the data pertaining to the Queens.
Recover data from the Propovus Lab
Enter the Xenolab and recover the data pertaining to the Queens.
Enter the Paragon Archives and recover possible information on the Kir'Ko past.
When the time comes, delete the compiled data…
Visit the Kir'Ko Camps nearby and hear the opinion of their Swarm Heralds on the rumors about the Queen of Queens.[br/][br/]Camps Visited: {INT_0}/{INT_1}[br/]Scout your surroundings.
Quest Description. Swarm Heralds are Kir'Ko leaders. The Queen of Queens is an ancient Kir'Ko broodmother (female)
Retrieve the Data from the Xeno Labs and collect them.[br/][br/]Data Found: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
Compile the Data by building a Genome Sequencer in one of your colonies.
Build the Genome Sequencer in once of your colonies.
Defeat one of the empires that support the Queen's Rebirth to disrupt their plans.
Visit the Kir'Ko Camps nearby and hear the opinion of their Swarm Heralds on the rumors about the Queen of Queens.
Search for the three Xeno Labs and collect their data.
Go to the indicated location with an army to investigate the Lab and retrieve the data
Reactivate the Reactor of Codon-17 to retrieve the Data.
Charge the Codon-17 Reactor to reactivate its server and retrieve the data.
Go to the indicated location with an army to investigate the Lab and retrieve the data
Kill the Syndicate to recover the Data from the Locus X3 laboratory.
Find Propovus, the Lab said to be nearby the Syndicate Capital belonging to Rebas Suntoro.
Quest Description Rebas Suntoro is a male Syndicate Commander
Go to the Propovus Lab location and retrieve the data.
Compile the Queen's genome by building the Genome Sequencer in one of your colonies.
Compile all Terratech data on the Kir'Ko Queen of Queens.
Quest Description Terratech is a terraforming company where the Amazon originate from
Destroy the Genome once you have it.
Defeat Cekto or Zarai in order to stop the revival.
Quest Description Cekto Xa'To is a female Kir'Ko, Zarai Loreg a female Amazon
Free the Kir'Ko from the Syndicate Prisons
Destroy or capture the Syndicate's headquarters to free the Kir'Ko they have been imprisoning there.
Let your colonies work to collect the Nectar of the Growth.
Collect the Nectar of the Growth like the Kir'Ko of old and spread their pollen.[br/][br/]Finish this special production project to complete a quest given by the Growth.
Venture to the Black Tangle to discover why your brethren have been drawn there in their dreams.
Quest Description The Black Tangle is a special sector with Void and Cosmite

Our ancient home world… it is unreal to finally be here. To taste the dulcet air and hear her humming melody. No dream experience could be as rousing as the fervor evoked by this moment! What answers will we find on Xa’Kir’Ko? There is so much we do not know about our past.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
Let us swarm out at once, explore our surroundings, visit the other Kir’Ko colonies from the fleet. Then we will see if there is more to the rumors about the Ez’Qi’Yu and her planned resurrection.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
Hox’Krit’Pat, {STR_LeaderName}! The Kir’Ko Xad’Ma are blessed by your invitation to our native world.
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit Hox’Krit’Pat is a Kir'Ko greeting and does not require localization
Sharing the coordinates of Xa’Kir’Ko with my fellow Kir'Ko was my pleasure. Tell me, have you heard any word of another Swarm Herald trying to revive the Queen of Queens?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

Oh {STR_LeaderName}, the Kir’Ko Xad’Ma do not concern themselves with that matter. We have learned that, even as individuals, we are relying just as much on our swarm mates as the Kir’Ko of old. Why should we give in to the instinctual desire of the Hive Mind, when we are doing rather well without it?
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit Xad'Ma is a Kir'Ko swarm

It is true, there are just as many of our brethren still yearning for the lost connection as there are Kir’Ko seeking to shape their own fate as individuals. The Kir’Ko Terym thank you and your colony for your thoughts.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
Swarm Herald {STR_LeaderName}, it is good to feel your presence! Have you heard the news? The Ez’Qi’Yu will return to her Hive! Let us all prepare to welcome home our Queen of Queens!
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit Xad'Ma is a Kir'Ko swarm
What news? So far, we only found distant rumors, but nothing of credibility.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

It is true! The hatch sister of the cocoon guardian of the Kir’Ko Nei’Lim’s third brood mother’s swarm gorger twice removed heard it from her Pa’Tchorr: the Queen will be made alive, here on Xa’Kir’Ko, by another Swarm Herald who followed your call.
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit Pa'Tchorr is Kir'Ko language for inseminator
I see... and how exactly does that Swarm Herald want to bring her back?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

How would I know? I am no Transcendent or Dream Reader… but isn’t it exhilarating? I can already hear the gentle voice of the Ez’Qi’Yu reach out to me in my mind. The chaos brought to the swarm by the Zok’Shiar will soon return to order in her motherly embrace.
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit Transcendant is a Kir'Ko unit, Dream Reader is a Kir'Ko iconic figure
Hox’Krit’Pat, brother! Why do I see so many troubled faces? Is it not a moment of unclouded elation to be back on Xa’Kir’Ko?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

Swarm Herald {STR_LeaderName}, we had been filled with joy when we took our first steps on our blessed home world. Until the Syndicate came and captured many of our colony, including our Swarm Herald Merrin Gau’Hu. They must have followed our fleet and are now taking our brethren prisoners as they land one by one.
Story Message. Speaker: male Kir'Ko unit
Grzz kl’tk rsh’nrr! Death to the Syndicate slavers that dare to defile our home planet! Give us their location. They shall regret the day they set foot on the land of our ancestors!
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) First sentence is phonetic
Your colony can rest at ease, brothers. The despicable Rebas Suntoro is no longer. The swarm has avenged the sack-bleeder’s crimes and emptied his prisons.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
You are a truth-seeker, {STR_LeaderName}. You tried to find answers and now we find ourselves face to face. I am Cekto Xa’To, Swarm Herald of the Kir’Ko Noz’Rix.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

Hox’Krit’Pat, Cekto Xa’To! I remember the Kir’Ko Noz’Rix from the second dream of Lit Bik – it is a colony with a strong Jix’Zok. Is it true what the rumors say, and you are indeed trying to revive the Ez’Qi’Yu?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Lit Bik was a Kir'Ko Swarm Speaker

Thank you, Swarm Herald Cekto Xa'To, for allowing me to join the telepathic connection. My name is Zarai Loreg, and I am here as an envoy of Empress Carminia, to make amends to your people for their troubled past. We wish to restore what was broken, and have offered Cekto Xa’To our help in recreating the Kir’Ko Queen of Queens.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)

With Zarai's expertise and access to old Terratech data, we can retrieve the correct genome and bring the Ez’Qi’Yu back. Once brought to life, our Queen will renew the Hive Mind that once united all Kir’Ko!
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)
Are you really going through with this? What about the Kir'Ko who do not wish for the Hive Mind and have grown used to their individuality and freedom?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

The Queens are the mellow voice that molds the swarm. This is how it once was and how it was always meant to be. All will connect to our new Hive in unity! {STR_LeaderName}, you have already returned their lost home world to our people. Will you also give them back their identity?
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

Even though this might not be the will of all Kir'Ko, the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. The swarm is more important than the single drone. Unity is our strength.[br/][br/]Swarm Herald Cekto Xa’To, how can I help?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

Cekto and I have started decoding the genome of the Ez’Qi’Yu. However, there are still many blank spots in our analysis, where Terratech classified or deleted their notes on the Queen. We believe the missing information is buried within Terratech’s original Kir’Ko study facilities here on Xa’Kir’Ko.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)

We know the locations of two of the facilities, a third one was detected near the landing site of an accursed Syndicate slaver. If you recover the data from those laboratories, we will be able to concentrate on the reconstruction of the genome. Beware though, there is a metal-clad human who is trying to obstruct our progress. Contact with him should be avoided at all costs.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

No, I cannot do this to my fellow Kir'Ko. The Queen and her Hive were once used to control us during the Zok’Shiar. It is something we cannot allow to ever happen again, even if it means losing a part of our past!
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Zok'Shiar is the Kir'Ko period of enslavement

You choose to abandon your own heritage? Krz’Tk Xrrlt Ptkch! No one shall stand in the way of Cekto Xa’To and her Queen! Try to interfere with our resurrection efforts and you will face the fury of the Kir’Ko Noz’Rix!
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

I am sure my people will grow stronger by approaching the future as free individuals. Cekto Xa’To is a fool to trust in the descendants of those who enslaved us. Her intentions may be good, but she is setting the stage for another Zok’Shiar without even realizing it. Her attempts to bring back the Ez’Qi’Yu must be stopped!
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
Seems the facility's reactor is offline. If we provide a good jolt to the power reservoirs, we should have enough time to retrieve whatever data is stored there.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

This is thrilling! There is a lot of information about specific parts of the Queen's DNA here. At a glance, it seems that this whole facility was dedicated to understanding the psionic abilities of the Ez’Qi’Yu.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
What the... the data was already moved! And it seems it was done recently…
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)
Trying to revive the Queens is a terrible mistake, Kir'Ko. The only ones worthy of worship are the Syndicate House leaders! If you want this data, come and get it, if you dare…

Despicable sack-bleeders! I am glad that is dealt with. Now, let's check the integrity of the data.[br/][br/]Good, those brutes didn't touch it. From what I can understand, this lab was focused on the hive mind and its encoding within the genome. This seems vital to the reconstruction of the Queens.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

This lab holds a sequence pattern for a large part of the Queen’s DNA and biological structure. How odd... some of the files were deleted; there are gaps in the data stream. We will see what we can recover during compilation.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

We visited all three facilities. If Terratech had any more data on the Ez’Qi’Yu, they hid it very well. But before we send anything out, I want to have a clear picture of what we have discovered. With everything at stake for our people, we need to be as cautious as a Hidden in a slaver camp.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

Zzir’rok! The clinical, analytic style in which Terratech documented the mutilation of our Queen fills me with anger and disgust. To them, lobotomizing her was a curious experiment, a scientific challenge. They had no mercy for their test subjects.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

It makes me wonder if putting our trust in the descendants of Terratech is a good idea. What if Nikael Gorodin was telling the truth, and the Queen will just be another instrument to control us Kir’Ko? On the other hand, this may be our only chance to reembrace our heritage.[br/][br/]I will…
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Nikael Gorodin is a Dvar Male commander
We are receiving the data… ah, yes, this is precisely the kind of information that we needed! Now it is only a matter of time until we will have reconstructed the Queen’s original genetic structure.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)

This is a great day for our people, {STR_LeaderName}! With the return of our Hive Queen, the last scars from the Zok’Shiar will be healed. All Kir’Ko will be reunited in her endearing mind, a place of peace and harmony, where no agony is known.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)
Greetings to … … am Nikael … … Dvar. Currently our … …. hope we … (The transmission abruptly ends.)
Story Message. Speaker: Nikael Gorodin (Male Dvar)
Ksz ksz! Another human that’s been failed by his technology. It keeps surprising me how they ever managed to make it into space without the gift of psionics!
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) First sentence is phonetic

(You feel another entity reaching out to your mind. Its voice is heralded by whispers from the Harmony Beyond.)[br/][br/]There, now this is much better! My name is Nikael Gorodin, leader of the Gorodin Consortium. Sorry for the intrusion, but this hag Zarai Loreg left me no choice with her hackers scrambling any conventional signals I send out.
Story Message. Speaker: Nikael Gorodin (Male Dvar)
It seems you are a follower of the Psynumbra teachings. I will forgive your indiscretion, this time. But tell me, why is Zarai Loreg blocking your communications?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko)

To keep me from warning your people of Empress Carminia and her plans. Carminia has no interest in the wellbeing of the Kir’Ko. All that she seeks is another way to subdue your race, and the Queen of Queens and her Hive projection are the ideal tools…
Story Message. Speaker: Nikael Gorodin (Male Dvar)
Another Zok’Shiar… no, this cannot be true! Your words are poison. You seek to sow mistrust in the Kir’Ko, as you fear the Hive that will reunite our swarm!
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Zok'Shiar is the Kir'Ko period of enslavement

I fear nothing save the wrath of CORE! The machine-god sent me with this good piece of advice for you, little bug. Take it or be a fool! Once you have gathered the data Zarai Loreg wants, destroy it and save your people. The decision is yours.
Story Message. Speaker: Nikael Gorodin (Male Dvar)
Another Zok’Shiar… then it is as I feared, and the resurrection of the Ez’Qi’Yu must be stopped. Tell me though, why would a human be interested in helping the Kir’Ko retain their freedom?
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Zok'Shiar is the Kir'Ko period of enslavement

I came to Xa’Kir’Ko on behalf of the benevolent CORE. In the limitless wisdom of its circuits, CORE is devising a new Star Union, one that will avoid the mistakes that were made in the days of old. And it is inviting the Kir’Ko to be a part of this new Union – as equals, not as slaves.
Story Message. Speaker: Nikael Gorodin (Male Dvar)
What have you done?! Are you mad with frenzy? With the original information destroyed, it will take us years to determine the Queen’s exact genome! Our heritage … the Hive… all may be lost forever.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

Do not look at me in anger, sister. There is so much left to discover about our past on Xa’Kir’Ko. We may yet be able to return to the Hive one day. But when we do, it will be through the evolution and will of the swarm, not through some laboratory creation grown in an alien cloning vat.
Story Message. Speaker: player character (Male or female Kir'Ko) Zok'Shiar is the Kir'Ko period of enslavement
You dare attack us after we agreed to help you restore your Hive Mind? You shall be crushed like that CORE mutt!
{STR_LeaderName}, you can't be serious... we trusted you... what a disappointment.
Well, well. Seems like you kicked an hornet's nest. No offense.[br/]But it seems to me that we are now both on the same side. Maybe we should update our deal?

Pesky Kir'Ko… I did not upload my consciousness into this host body to let it be erased by some bug. Luckily, I have plenty of new vessels to pick from in the Amazon growth chambers. Until next time, mortal. Long live the Omega group, long live Gerol Tichly!
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon) Gerol Tichly is the name of the man who uploaded his conciousness to Zarai's body

The Omega group? Gerol Tichly? It would appear your supposed friend is not who she claimed to be, Cekto Xa’To. What other information may she have concealed? Do you really want the fate of our people depend on the technology of a shady human you know so little about?

It is true… my love for the Ez’Qi’Yu made me ignore any doubts I had about Zarai Loreg’s motives. Only now can I sense the danger of her promises.[br/][br/]But our Queen, the Hive... it may all be lost forever if we abandon this project.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

Do not let your mind dwell in gloom, sister. There is so much left to discover about our past on Xa’Kir’Ko. We may yet be able to return to the Hive one day. But when we do, it will be through the evolution and will of the swarm, not through some laboratory creation grown in an alien cloning vat.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

So the Kir'Ko are turning against each other... fascinating! And unfortunate: we lost a helpful asset. The Kir’Ko integration project will have to rest for some time. Empress Carminia will not be pleased. Lucky for you, the Empress has a very forgiving nature. We will meet again, {STR_LeaderName}!
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)

Leave now, Zarai Loreg of the Amazons. I hope you are wrong, and we will never have to sense your kind on Xa’Kir’Ko again. This world belongs to the Kir’Ko. We shape it, just as it shapes us in return. Past, present, future – they all align in the dream of the Kir’Ko Terym and their swarm.
Look at this, we don't even need to go after them! The bugs come to us willingly. This is the best business enterprise I ever got myself into!
Story Message. Speaker: Rebas Suntoro (Syndicate Male)
Careful who you speak to, sack-bleeder! You are in the presence of Swarm Herald {STR_LeaderName}. Try to put us back in a cage and we will unleash our fury upon you. You have no power here.

Try? I have been pretty successful so far, if I dare say so myself. Want me to show you the way to the cages and help you count how many there are? Maybe help you join them? I am sure we can make space…
Story Message. Speaker: Rebas Suntoro (Syndicate Male)

Your slaver days are over, sack-bleeder. Taste the thrax of the Engulfer! Share the pain of the Tormented! Vomit blight and disease as we feed your corpse to the jaws of the Ravenous, where it will finally find purpose.

Swarm Herald {STR_LeaderName}, thank Ro’Qwer’Z for the rescue! Like the hero of old, your name and deeds will be passed along in the dreams of the Kir’Ko Shis’Lax. It would be a great joy for me and my followers to join your colony. Will you accept this humble request?
Story Message. Speaker: Merrin Gau'Hu (Kir'Ko male unit) Ro'Qwer'Z is a male ancient Kir'Ko freedom fighter
We gladly welcome the Kir’Ko Shis’Lax into our swarm. There is always place within our castes for those who had to suffer at the hands of the sack-bleeders.
Unhand me, insects! You lot were bred to obey!
Story Message. Speaker: Rebas Suntoro (Syndicate Male)
Die, vile creature! May your death bring peace to future Kir’Ko generations.
This smell… the sweet, verdant odor – I recognize it from the fifth dream of Kzara Tosh.
Story Message. Speaker: player character. Kzara Tosh is an important female historic Kir'Ko figure.
The ones that were once lost are returning. Greetings, Kir'Ko. You are different from when we sensed you last.
Story Message. Speaker: Growth. (Genderless sentient plant)
You remember our ancestors? What can you tell us of Xa’Kir’Ko? What were we like before the invasion of the Star Union?

You are asking many questions, Symbiont. In the past, no words were needed.[br/][br/](A vision appears in your mind. You see the sprawling landscape of Xa’Kir’Ko, with overgrown ponds and flowers towering like mighty trees. The air is swarming with ancestral Kir’Ko, hurrying from one colorful blossom to another.)
Story Message. Speaker: Growth. (Genderless sentient plant)
So it is true that our two species were once living together in harmony. The allure of the Nectar is still present in the dreams of each Kir’Ko.
Queen and Mother Node, Kir’Ko and Growth: we all prospered together.[br/][br/]Collect our Nectar, Symbiont. Spread our pollen. Relive what once was and you will find the answers you seek.
Story Message. Speaker: Growth. (Genderless sentient plant)
You remembered, Symbiont. New saplings are blooming as both our paths returned to intertwine.
Story Message. Speaker: Growth. (Genderless sentient plant)

My swarm-brothers and sisters collecting your Nectar are giddy with pleasure. Your psionic memory allowed them to delve in our past. Some mentioned a place of deep shadows, unseizable and yet strangely familiar, which they saw in their visions…
They sensed the black tangle. We do not grow there, but the Kir’Ko can spread their roots in places we avoid. Tread with care, Symbiont. The black tangle lies in a far distance.
Story Message. Speaker: Growth. (Genderless sentient plant)

This place is bizarre... I can feel the currents of the Void pull at the foundations of our reality. Its humming melody is growing louder inside my mind as it starts resonating with the dreams from the past. No… no… the sounds are too intense! I cannot shut them out…

(You see a purple flash followed by a crackling sound, while the earth beneath your feet trembles. Only now you notice an enormous body jammed into the mountain side next to you. From its cracked scarab-blue husk, Kir’Ko-like figures start emerging, some gesturing towards the black emptiness of the Void while others are pointing in the direction of the forest.)
Story Message. Speaker: third person narration

(A second flash, then another, and another, until the area is pulsing with purple light as more and more creatures like the first spill out onto the rocks. Just as you try to focus your mind and reach out to one of the arrivers, your sight becomes shrouded and the vision ends.)
Story Message. Speaker: third person narration

The images… the flashes… were they a true dream experience or just a hallucination? If what I saw is true, our ancestors did not always live on Xa’Kir’Ko – they came to it travelling through the Void! Is that where our psionic abilities come from? Is this why we are so different?

There are so many new questions swarming through my mind. Once we have dealt with current pressing matters, I will have to invite our people’s wisest Dream Readers to share and discuss this discovery. But for now, the resurrection of the Ez Qi’Yu requires all our attention.
Found and shared the location of Xa'Kir'Ko
Defeat Zarai to assure the Kir'Ko remain free willed.
Defeat Cekto to assure the Kir'Ko remain free willed.
It would appear that this Kir’Ko is a sneaky one. It doesn’t matter though; your betrayal will prove only a minor setback for our plans.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)

The Kir’Ko Noz’Rix had high expectations in you. After you discovered Xa’Kir’Ko, it seemed the two of us were destined to shape the future of our race together. But I see now that your reputation was undeserved. Your actions are a disgrace for every Kir’Ko Swarm Herald.
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko) Noz'Rix is Cekto's swarm

Do not falter, friend. Even though Cekto Xa’To may be dead, her vision of the recreated Kir’Ko Queen lives on. Take these blueprints of an Amazon cloning laboratory. Cekto had used the same schematics to adapt her Kir’Ko technology to work with ours. You should be able to do the same and this way complete her work when the time is ready.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)
This body may soon be destroyed, but my consciousness will live on. Next time we meet, I expect you to have completed our collective project, Swarm Heralds of the Kir’Ko.
Story Message. Speaker: Zarai Loreg (Female Amazon)
Such last words could only come from someone using Synthesis technology. I wonder if Zarai Loreg is correct and we will indeed meet again someday.

Maybe, maybe not. What matters now is that we take her last words to heart and finish recreating the Queen. Take these blueprints of an Amazon cloning laboratory. Once all data has been gathered, use them to set up the genetic sequencer and the Ez Qi’Yu will come back to life!
Story Message. Speaker: Cekto Xa'To (Female Kir'Ko)

Zzir’rok! The clinical, analytic style in which Terratech documented the mutilation of our Queen fills me with anger and disgust. To them, lobotomizing her was a curious experiment, a scientific challenge. They had no mercy for their test subjects.
Story Message. Speaker: player character Zzir'rok is a Kir'Ko curseword and does not need to be localized

It makes me wonder if putting our trust in the technology of Terratech is a good idea. What if Nikael Gorodin was telling the truth, and the Queen will just be another instrument to control us Kir’Ko? On the other hand, this may be our only chance to reembrace our heritage.[br/][br/]I will…
Let us set up the laboratory for the genetic reconstruction of the Queen. With the data we gathered and the existing research from Zarai and Cekto, we should have everything we need to get started.

No, the risk of another Zok’Shiar is too high. There is so much left to discover about our past on Xa’Kir’Ko. We may still be able to return to the Hive one day. But when we do, it will be through the evolution and will of the swarm, not through some laboratory creation grown in an alien cloning vat.

This is a great day for our people! With the return of our Hive Queen, the last scars from the Zok’Shiar will be healed. All Kir’Ko will be reunited in her endearing mind, a place of peace and harmony, where no agony is known.
